DataElement.preferredName: Person Allergic Reaction Pazopanib Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has a history of allergic reaction, an adverse local or general response from exposure to an allergen, form pazopanib, a small molecule inhibitor of multiple protein tyrosine kinases with potential antineoplastic activity, or similar compounds as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Allergic Reaction Pazopanib Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a history of allergic reaction, an adverse local or general response from exposure to an allergen, form pazopanib, a small molecule inhibitor of multiple protein tyrosine kinases with potential antineoplastic activity, or similar compounds as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Allergic reaction Pazopanib Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by an adverse local or general response from exposure to an allergen.:A small molecule inhibitor of multiple protein tyrosine kinases with potential antineoplastic activity. Pazopanib selectively inhibits vascular endothelial growth factor receptors (VEGFR)-1, -2 and -3, c-kit and platelet derived growth factor receptor (PDGF-R), which may result in inhibition of angiogenesis in tumors in which these receptors are upregulated.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by an adverse local or general response from exposure to an allergen.

A small molecule inhibitor of multiple protein tyrosine kinases with potential antineoplastic activity. Pazopanib selectively inhibits vascular endothelial growth factor receptors (VEGFR)-1, -2 and -3, c-kit and platelet derived growth factor receptor (PDGF-R), which may result in inhibition of angiogenesis in tumors in which these receptors are upregulated.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
